mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Ann Pamela Cunningham to Nancy Halsted, 1869 May 11
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Cunningham, Ann Pamela, 1816-1875
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Ann Pamela Cunningham to Nancy Halsted, Vice Regent for New Jersey, May 11, 1869. Mount Vernon. Professor Henry's advice on "souvenirs." President visits Mount Vernon. Training new secretary, Mrs. Tiffey. Worried over return trip to South Carolina. Gardener Craig has gotten married. Asks for Association's bills. Wallpaper described, 2nd floor room examined, several layers; Blue and Yellow Rooms, River Room and Lafayette Room. Gifts of bedroom paper, mower. Freight still charged to the Association. Bad weather reduces visitors.
